postContent:
Welcome to **ngx-Dumblog**!

An simple and dumb (really dumb) blog front-end for the GitHub Pages service.

- First, you won't be able to run the compiled (prod) version locally because of the CORS settings most browsers have. Maybe IE would let you do it. (lmao)
- In the settings.json file you will find some settings like the 'About' text, blog name and how many posts dumblog should load on the home page.
- There's also the default favicon, which you can change.
- Included in .github.io/?page=editor is the editor called Canvas, based on the CK Editor.

To publish on GitHub Pages you just need to commit to your .github.io repo the files generated in the /dist folder after you run npm install and then npm run build on your console. (There's also pre-compiled files on the repo.)

If you use the pre-compiled version, you don't need to (re)build anything. Just modify the settings.json and publish it! The pre-compiled version is generated just by using npm run build.

And that's it! Happy blogging!
